summary: A growing number of people rely on Medicaid personal care services for help with daily tasks like bathing and eating. However, these types of services are at high risk for fraud and abuse—e.g., services that were paid for but never provided. We testified that federal and state rules for protecting Medicaid beneficiaries varied across personal care services programs. We also found that Medicaid needs better...
title: Medicaid Personal Care Services: More Harmonized Program Requirements and Better Data Are Needed
